body:
AppImage appears to be a growing trend of sorts but I don't think it suits Electron's distribution methodology.  Applications built on Electron should be asked to provide AppImage files (not Electron).  Electron itself is just a couple of pre-built binaries that can be distributed however you want.  (Could be `.deb`, `.rpm` or `AppImage`).

Your example of a `.dmg` explains this quite well I think, we provide a ZIP file of prebuilts for macOS and if an application wants to distribute a DMG then they generate a DMG and put our prebuilts inside.  The same concept should be applied to AppImage, we provide the prebuilts, applications should do whatever they want with them.

If you want to build `AppImage` files for you Application I believe the `AppImage` repository has a guide on how to do it üëç
